III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/03/24, a youth was smoking marijuana in the bathroom.
There are concerns that a staff member offered to cover for the
youth and the youth has in turn offered to cover for the staff
member.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff
2 reported on November 7, 2024, Youth B and Youth C got into a
verbal altercation, and Youth C was also upset with Youth A. He
reported Youth C made the comment Youth A had marijuana in
her room and this statement led him to do a room search within
Youth A’s room with her permission. Staff 2 reported Youth C
commented as well that on November 3, 2024, she heard Staff 1
tell Youth A he would cover up for her smoking marijuana. He
reported Youth C made this statement loud enough for the other
youth to hear. Staff 2 reported Youth C does not get along with
Staff 1 and knows Youth B has a positive relationship with him. He
reported he has worked with Staff 1 and has been coaching him to
set more boundaries with the youth. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 is a
younger staff and is more friendly with the youth.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A reported she was caught smoking marijuana in her
bathroom on November 3, 2024 by Staff 1 and Staff 3. She
reported Staff 3 called the on-call supervisor and Staff 1 told her
she could not go to driver’s training. Youth A denied getting the
marijuana from staff and noted she goes to school off-grounds.
She denied Staff 1 ever offering to cover for her and stated he
was the staff to cancel her driver’s training because of this
incident. Youth A reported Youth C reported concerns to Staff 2
about Youth A using marijuana because Youth C wants to get in
trouble. She reported she allowed Staff 2 to search her room, and
they found marijuana in there. Youth A reported Youth C is the
one to tell Staff 2 that Staff 1 said he would cover for Youth A
because she does not like Staff 1 and wants to get him in trouble.
2

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth B reported last Sunday, Youth A was caught smoking
marijuana in her bathroom. She reported she told Youth A that
she would take the blame for providing the marijuana to her.
Youth B reported Staff 1 was the one to catch Youth A smoking
because they could smell the marijuana. She reported Staff 1
never said he would allow her to smoke marijuana and stated
Staff 1 called the supervisor right away about the incident. Youth
B reported Youth A admitted to smoking marijuana and Staff 1 told
Youth A she could not go to driver's training because of smoking.
She reported Youth C reported this to Staff 2 because she wanted
Staff 1 to get in trouble. Youth B explained Youth C does not like
Staff 1. He is the one to call Youth C’s mom when she is in trouble
because he speaks Spanish. She reported Youth C also does not
get along with her and is trying to get Staff 1 in trouble as he is
one of the staff Youth B is close with. Youth B reported she feels
safe at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 14, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth C reported on the morning of November 3, 2024, she was
out of the home for part of the morning and when she returned
home, she could smell marijuana near Youth A’s bathroom. She
reported she does not know if Youth A got in trouble for this.
Youth C reported a couple of days later she heard Youth A tell
Staff 4 that Staff 1 was going to cover for her by saying he did not
smell marijuana on November 3, 2024. She reported she did not
think that was fair and told Staff 2 about this concern. Youth C
reported she knew Youth A had marijuana in her bedroom as well,
which she also disclosed to Staff 2. She reported this resulted in
Staff 2 completing a room search of Youth A’s room.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 14, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 reported he worked on November 3, 2024, and was the
one to catch Youth A smoking marijuana in her bathroom. He
reported when he was doing a room check he could smell the
marijuana coming from Youth A’s bathroom. Staff 1 stated Youth
A was supposed to go to driver’s training that day but due to her
being under the influence, he told her she would not be allowed to
go. He reported he told Staff 3 to cancel the driver's training
because Staff 3 was the staff who would transport Youth A to the
program. Staff 1 reported he talked with Youth A about the
situation, and she admitted to smoking marijuana. He reported
3

she became upset because she knew this could affect her
placement in independent living. Staff 1 reported Youth B stated to
Youth A that she would say the marijuana was hers so that Youth
A would not lose her placement. He reported he redirected the
conversation and spoke with Supervisor 2 about the incident. Staff
1 reported Staff 3 completed the incident report because Staff 3
was the one to call the driver's training facility and start the phone
call with the on-call supervisor, as Staff 1 was processing the
situation with Youth A. He denied ever telling Youth A that he
would cover for her or lie about her smoking marijuana. Staff 1
denied providing marijuana to Youth A and reported she most
likely got it while she was at school off-grounds. He reported he
was not involved in any room checks.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on November 14, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he worked
on November 3, 2024 with Staff 1. Staff 3 reported he transported
another youth that morning and when he returned Staff 1 reported
to him concerns of Youth A smoking marijuana in her bathroom.
He reported Youth C had also made reports of smelling marijuana
from Youth A’s bathroom when she returned from a visit with Staff
5, which Staff 5 told him about those concerns. He reported he
was the one to call the driver’s training facility and on-call
supervisors about the situation while Staff 1 talked with Youth A.
Staff 3 reported when he was on the phone with Supervisor 3,
Staff 1 spoke to Supervisor 3 about the situation. He reported he
did not witness or hear any concerns of Staff 1 telling Youth A that
he would cover for her smoking marijuana. Staff 3 reported Staff 1
was the one to make the initial report so that Youth A would not
get behind the wheel under the influence. He reported he does not
have any concerns about Staff 1’s work ethic.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed via phone on November 19,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 3
reported he was the on-call supervisor on November 3, 2024. He
reported he talked to Staff 1 on the phone about the concerns of
Youth A smoking marijuana in her bathroom before her driver’s
training class. Supervisor 3 reported Staff 1 reported he was
concerned about Youth A being under the influence and behind
the wheel so it was agreed upon that she would not go. He
reported Staff 1 followed the proper protocol of reporting the
situation to the on-call supervisor and making sure Youth A
remained safe. Supervisor 3 reported he directly supervises Staff
1 and is not concerned with his work performance. He reported
Staff 1 is a listening ear for the youth and holds them accountable
for their actions. Supervisor 3 reported Youth A takes college
4

courses off grounds. He reported he did not believe Staff 1 would
tell Youth A that he would cover for her, as he had called the on-
call supervisor right after the situation had occurred. Supervisor 3
reported Youth A talked to Supervisor 3 about her concern about
being caught smoking marijuana and it impact on her independent
living placement.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on November 26,2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she did not
work on the day of the incident, but Youth A did tell her Staff 1 and
Staff 3 found her smoking marijuana in the bathroom. She
reported Youth A was concerned about how smoking marijuana
was going to affect her independent living placement. Staff 4
denied Youth A ever stated Staff 1 would cover for her. She
reported after hearing about the situation, Staff 1 and Staff 3 did
everything they were supposed to do when they had concerns
about Youth A smoking in her bathroom.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 14, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Administrator 2 reported she has not heard or seen any concerns
with Staff 1 work performance. She reported she had not heard of
concerns of Staff 1 stating he would cover for any youth and hold
them responsible for their actions. Administrator 2 reported Staff 1
had made sure Youth A could not attend driver's training after she
was caught smoking and had informed upline supervision of the
situation. She noted she is aware Youth A was upset that her
being caught smoking could affect her move into an independent
living program and could see Staff 1 comforting her by telling her
things will work out not that he would hide the situation.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 14, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor 1 reported she was involved when Staff 2 called for a
room search completed on Youth A’s room on November 7, 2024.
She reported she heard of the concerns Youth C reported that
Staff 1 was going to cover for Youth A which did not make sense
as there were already incident reports completed on November 3,
2024, about Youth A smoking marijuana and Staff 1 being
involved in finding this out. Supervisor 1 reported she did not have
any concerns about Staff 1’s work performance.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 14, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor 2 reported she received a call from Staff 3 on
November 3, 2024, about Staff 1 catching Youth A smoking
5

marijuana in her bathroom. She reported Staff 3 had informed her
that Youth A would not be attending driver’s training due to being
under the influence. Supervisor 2 reported she did not speak with
Staff 1 but did get the report of the incident. She reported the staff
followed the proper procedure and there were no noted concerns
of Staff 1 trying to cover up that Youth A was smoking.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 11/03/2024 in Youth A’s bedroom hallway was
reviewed on 11/14/2024 with MDHHS Worker. The video footage
began around 9:45am where Youth A entered her own bathroom.
Staff 1 and Staff 3 are witnessed throughout the video to complete
checks on Youth A in variable intervals not exceeding fifteen
minutes. Around 10:20am Youth A had exited her bathroom and
Staff 1 had spoken with Youth A immediately after she exited. The
conversation could not be heard over video.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Incident Report Dated November 3, 2024,
completed by Staff 3- The incident report was consistent
with Staff 3’s interview.
- Facility Incident Report Dated November 7, 2024,
completed by Staff 2- The incident report was consistent
with Staff 2’s interview.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has two
disciplinary actions within his file not related to the this
investigation. Staff 1 is complaint with all training
regulations.
- Facility Youth Development Specialist Procedures with
recent revision date 02/2022- This procedure notes staff
are to support the youth at the facility by being a positive
and supportive adult figure who can help youth shift
perceptions so they can be successful. It notes that staff
are to maintain clear and appropriate boundaries with the
youth.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, there was no findings of Staff 1 stating they would
cover for Youth A smoking marijuana or providing marijuana to
youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
